alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 27 at 1:36PM MST until July 27 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... areas near Kaibito in Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 445 PM MST. * At 134 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding has been reported along Highway 98 near Kaibito. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Navajo National Monument, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Kaibito, Lake Powell and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Peach Wash, Begashibito Wash, Chaiyahi Creek, Navajo Creek, Starting Water Wash, Kaibito Creek, Square Butte Wash, Sour Water Wash and Sand Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
